metadata.title: Prolonged depletion of circulating CD4 + T lymphocytes and acute monocytosis after pantropic canine coronavirus infection in dogs

abstract.original_text: A hypervirulent strain (CB/05) of canine coronavirus was employed to infect oronasally 11-week-old pups. Peripheral blood monocytes (CD14 + ), T lymphocytes (CD4 + and CD8 + ) and B lymphocytes (CD21 + ) were studied by flow cytometry within 5 days post-infection (p.i.) and at later time points. Infection

sentences.segment_text: A hypervirulent strain ( CB/05 ) of canine coronavirus was employed to infect oronasally 11-week-old pups .
T lymphocytes ( CD4 + and CD8 + ) and B lymphocytes ( CD21 + ) were studied by flow cytometry within 5 days post-infection ( p.i. ) and at later time points .
